ygData.subject: Re: Here is what I did (was:RE: [eqbards] [egbarts] Changing computer s)
ygData.msgSnippet: cool, i was holding off on upgrading to pro, until i heard someone doing eq with it :) well, i m getting cable modem today, so w2k tomorrow! woohoo!
ygData.messageBody:
cool, i was holding off on upgrading to pro, until i heard someone doing eq
with it :)
well, i'm getting cable modem today, so w2k tomorrow! woohoo!

(incidentally, Computer Gaming World (CGW) reported "The Neptune (win2k
team) team tested compatibility with Windows 2000 using about 800 games from
PC Data's sales charts since the first Windows 95 games began shipping years
ago. What they found wasn't pretty: Only 50-60% of the games will run "out
of the box" under Windows 2000. Some could be made to run with a few tweaks
or hacks, but many simply tanked." - April, 2000 issue, p. 104, Under the
Hood, Loyd Case)


MacGrough Mich'Rathe
----- Original Message -----
From: Reeves, Patrick W <pwr3@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, March 06, 2000 8:49 AM
Subject: Here is what I did (was:RE: [eqbards] [egbarts] Changing computer
s)


> From: "Reeves, Patrick W" <pwr3@...>
>
> I upgraded my system to Win 2K over the weekend. I did a clean install of
> Win2K onto a brand new harddrive (it is wierd having the OS on the H drive
> hah). I installed EQ and patched up (I have a cable modem so this went
very
> fast). Then I copied over the contents of my old EQ folder to the new
one,
> just telling it no when it asked to overwrite existing files. It worked
> fine. Also with Win 2k and a clean install I can weave 4 songs, if my
> timing is absolutely perfect :) Was weaving Chords of Dissounce, Denon's
> Discord, Niv's & Hymn last night vs LDCs & Lava Beetles.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: B. Bedford [mailto:bbedford@...]
> Sent: Saturday, March 04, 2000 5:20 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] [egbarts] Changing computers
>
>
> From: "B. Bedford" <bbedford@...>
>
> Hmm...tough call. You will need to do the install again to get everything
> in your registry (copying the whole directory might not work because of
> this), so I'd say just go with patching it again. Its the safest option
ya
> have. If ya have a bad connection to the internet, I'd say just let it
run
> over the night...there aren't too many things that need to be patched, I'd
> say no more than 100mb worth of stuff. On a 56k connection, this would
take
> about a nights worth of downloading.
> Heh, good luck man, hope it works out
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Papa Legba
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Sent: Friday, March 03, 2000 12:59 PM
> Subject: [eqbards] [egbarts] Changing computers
>
>
> From: Papa Legba <legba@...>
>
> TOtally non bardish, but you people seem to know everything. I got a
> new computer (woohoo!) What is the best way to move EQ over to it? I
> assume I will have to reinstall and wait about 10 hours getting
> patched... Are there any files I should copy over?
> --
> We now return to the non-stop rock.
>
> Matt DeBarger
>
